FuncDef:
The queue-priority disable command disables the inbound traffic classification function for a specified board.
The undo queue-priority disable command enables the inbound traffic classification function for a specified board.
The queue-priority enable command enables traffic classification for upstream traffic on a subcard.
The undo queue-priority enable command disables traffic classification for upstream traffic on a subcard.
By default, the inbound traffic classification function is enabled.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of a board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies a subcard ID.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 4294967295.

Examples: Enter system view, return user view with return command.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The queue-priority enable command provides the same functions as the undo queue-priority disable command.
The undo queue-priority enable command provides the same functions as the queue-priority disable command.
